page.title: 15FILKINS: EASTLEACH BUILDINGS
page.content: In the private sector. 8 dwellings have been built in stone and 5 in rendered construction, 4 farm buildings convert- ed for housing and 6 for industry. Mrs Carter of Carterton endowed a spacious well-built village hall for the men but it is now used by all. In the 1930s Sir Stafford Cripps set up a Centre with hot baths, a doctor's surgery and care- taker's flat, to be run by the Parish Council. A swimming pool, playground & bowling green followed. Filkins Hall, rebuilt this century, is now to be con- verted to flats. In EASTLEACH the fine medieval Church of St Martin is now ad- ministered by the Redundant Churches Society. The 12th Century Church of St Andrew has a chevron carved Norman porch, with 'Christ in Glory' above the door. The filled-in arches in the north wall of the nave indicate that the church was once much larger.
